summary: Nintendo 500  #013- Mewtwo  I know I said I'd be drawing Pokemon with their trainers, but for a legendary powerhouse like Mewtwo...
caption:
Nintendo 500  #013- Mewtwo 

I know I said I’d be drawing Pokemon with their trainers, but for a legendary powerhouse like Mewtwo it’s only fitting for him to be on his own! 

This was the last pic I had already finished before the 8/8 Smash direct! 

 My next character might be influenced by it…

blog.name: spectraspecs-draws
blog.title: Specs Draws Stuff - I Take Pokémon Requests
blog.description: Attached to Specs Writes Stuff - All chapters of Bulbasaur: Private Investigator - Not like anyone’s asked, but I don’t take commissions because drawing is just a thing to me, not a livelihood. But feel free to drop a Pokémon request in my ask box! If you want to use one of my drawings as a profile pic, then a.) not Gubo. Gubo is mine, you can’t have him, and b.) just reblog the pic and give credit, thx.

summary: Inspired by this post and posted on my main blog here. [Image - A Charmander singing passionately into a microphone, in a floor...
caption:
Inspired by this post and posted on my main blog here.

[Image - A Charmander singing passionately into a microphone, in a floor length sleeveless red dress because I didn’t want to draw her feet. A Granbull in a suit stands by watching - he is the director. An unimpressed Electrode sits in the audience - he owns the theatre.]

title: Forretress - 205
body:
It keeps itself inside its steel shell. The shell is opened when it is catching prey, but it is so quick that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.

- Pokemon Emerald

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Heatmor and Durant
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Heatmor and Durant
body:
631: Heatmor

While two Pokemon being rivaling counterparts to each other is nothing new, Heatmor and Durant here certainly take it in a much more different direction. Starting with the Fire-Type Anteater, Heatmor is a cool one. The grumpy eyes being so far up the snout just looks hilarious to me and I love it. But most everything else about it is just rad. The cool arm details, the pips running along its body with an exhaust tail. And not to mention its “tongue” being a long, swirling flame that curls around in a cool way.

Personal Score: 9.5/10

Really cool! But why Fire type?

632: Durant

Because its prey ants are made of metal. And I can’t believe it 1. took us this long to get ants, and 2. that said ants are not too shabby a Pokemon design themselves. Ants seemed like such a basic insect on their own that you’d need to go after one of the more exotic species or play up the swarm aspect to make an ant Pokemon interesting. But fun enough, Durant is actually the rare Bug type that follows insect anatomy to a tee. Three segments, six legs n all. It’s even got some cool metallic bits going on there, and some real mean looking eyes. Durant also gives me some Earthbound vibes. It and the Titanic Ant are not that different looking from each other.

The one huge shame about Durant is that they were following the Pokemon Rivalry formula far too hard with these two. Durant is already at a disadvantage given the typing, so why not make it a little weaker in order to make room for females of the species to evolve into queen ants or something? It’s something that’s sorely missing, and it’s not even like you’d have to give up the part where Durant queens are exceptionally vulnerable to Heatmor either.

Personal Score: 8/10

A cool bug though.

Overall:

An interesting rivalry duo. It’s just a shame about Durant’s state though.

[Archive]

tags: between the stars and the sea
summary: Could we have a list of the Pokémon starters (any and all generations you feel like) in order of your favorites?
question: Could we have a list of the Pokémon starters (any and all generations you feel like) in order of your favorites?
answer:
Sure! :D 

My favorite generations (both for starters and for overall Pokemon) are Gen I and Gen II, no contest whatsoever. Their designs are classic. Of Gen 1 and Gen 2, my favs are Totodile, Cyndaquil, and Charmander. But I truly love ALL of Gen I and Gen II’s starters dearly. ♥ (Also I tend to heavily favor fire and water for whatever reason.)

Next on my list are Oshawott (love that little otter ♥) and Rowlet (its SUPER EXTRA grass/ghost final evolution is so good). 

Piplup and Snivy are also pretty good, mainly because Piplup is adorable and Snivy is just… snooty and hilarious. 

There are a few others I like, but the above are definitely my favorites (in order). Most of the other starters I’m “meh”/neutral about. 

Thanks so much for this Ask!!
